definition: dash/Chinese dash ── (punct., double the length of the western dash)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Follow this up with a succinct description of the location followed by a dash and a time reference.
sentences.chinese: 接着，简要地说明地点，然后用一个破折号提及时间。

sentences.english: Copy the activation code to the keygen with the numbers seperated by dashes .
sentences.chinese: 复制激活码的凯基与分隔的数字破折号。

sentences.english: Here, too, the lon must be followed by a sh.
sentences.chinese: 这里也一样，应当在冒号之后加破折号。

sentences.english: Underscores are just bad. Stick to dashes.
sentences.chinese: 下划线只有一个糟字可言，坚持使用破折号。

sentences.english: Don't try to drive one with your in-dash receiver's built-in amplifier.
sentences.chinese: 不要设法驾驶一与您的在破折号接收器的固定放大器。

sentences.english: The dash is longer than the hyphen.
I even started using dashes in my writing.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至开始在作文时运用破折号。

sentences.english: Typing square bracket caret zero dash nine will exclude all numbers from matching.
sentences.chinese: 输入方括号插入零九个破折号将排除所有号码匹配。

definition: Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
Chinese underdot (punct. used for emphasis, sim. to Western italics)
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
